<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/06/04/apple-s-bringing-people-operating-systems-together?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple’s Bringing People (and Operating Systems) Together
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple’s annual developer conference, WWDC, <a href="https://www.axios.com/live-apple-debuts-new-mac-pro-previews-ios-macos-updates-df00af15-d493-4085-868a-71940cf54386.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">kicked off</a> yesterday, and...gulp some coffee now, we’ve got a lot of changes to catch you up on. As it deals with <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tech-antitrust-exclusive/exclusive-u-s-justice-dept-considering-apple-probe-sources-idUSKCN1T42DD?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a nosy Justice Department</a>, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/05/15/apple-suppliers-foxconn-japan-display-report-disappointing-results.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flagging iPhone sales</a>, and <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-i-phone-sales-in-china-could-be-cut-by-50-thanks-to-trumps-trade-war-115735359.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a U.S. conflict with China</a> that rhymes with “paid lore,” Apple (-1.01%) is making moves with virtually all its flagship products. The tech giant...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Unveiled a new Mac Pro. </strong>The new professional desktop computer <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/6/3/18646424/apple-mac-pro-redesign-new-specs-features-photos-wwdc-2019?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">comes with</a> bells, whistles, and a whole lot of storage. It’s the newest model in two years and costs a cool $5,999, though Apple says comparable products go for over $8,000.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wants you to know it cares about privacy…*mumbles* unlike </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>some</em></strong><strong style="color:#000"> people. </strong>It <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-touts-new-privacy-features-amid-scrutiny-of-tech-giants-11559589479?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revealed iOS 13</a>, which includes Dark Mode for iPhone as well as some notable privacy features.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>One function limits apps’ abilities to pull user's location to a one-time permission (rather than an indefinite one).</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Another allows users to sign into third-party apps with an Apple ID instead of Google and Facebook accounts, which are vulnerable to data harvesting.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Confirmed rumors it’s replacing iTunes. </strong>Apple’s newest desktop operating system, called MacOS Catalina (no relation to the wine mixer), <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/talkingtech/2019/06/03/whats-new-from-apple-at-wwdc/1327644001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">replaces iTunes</a> with desktop versions of the Apple Music, TV, and Podcast apps currently on iPads and iPhones.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Announced an iPad-specific operating system. </strong>It’s called iPadOS, and it’s intended to make iPads feel more like desktop computers. As <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/03/technology/wwdc-apple.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the NYT puts it</a>, Apple’s trying to turn the iPad into your work computer.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Updated the Apple Watch. </strong>The new WatchOS includes an App Store for your wrist as well as a bunch more Apple apps like audiobooks and voice memos.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whew...nice job reading all that. Some more context: At last year’s WWDC, <a href="https://www.axios.com/bringing-ios-apps-to-the-mac-1528139732-8504ade4-45f7-468f-af9f-5ad976cb3c79.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Axios identified</a> the company’s efforts to integrate iOS and MacOS going forward. Most of the developments we learned yesterday point in that direction.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F06%2F04%2Fapple-s-bringing-people-operating-systems-together" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=We%E2%80%99ve+got+a+lot+of+changes+to+catch+you+up+on&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/06/04/apple-s-bringing-people-operating-systems-together&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/06/04/regulators-play-man-man-defense-big-tech?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Regulators Play Man-to-Man Defense Against Big Tech
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Big Tech regulation has turned into a fantasy league in which agencies <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ftc-to-examine-how-facebook-s-practices-affect-digital-competition-11559576731?mod=hp_lead_pos1&mod=article_inline&mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">choose</a> which massive company they’ll be responsible for overseeing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">With the #2 overall pick...</strong>The FTC is reportedly prepping an antitrust investigation into Facebook, which comes days after reports suggesting the DOJ will do the same with Google. And even if this is a half-PPR league, don't count out Apple and Amazon.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Apple </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/06/03/apple-drops-on-report-that-doj-has-jurisdiction-over-potential-antitrust-probe.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">answers</a></span><span> to the DOJ, which is </span><span><em>also</em></span><span> allegedly mulling an antitrust case as of this week.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Amazon (-4.64%) </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/06/02/amazon-could-face-heightened-antitrust-scrutiny-under-new-agreement-between-us-regulators/?utm_term=.4985fc8705fa&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">looks</a></span><span> to the FTC, though no concrete moves have been made yet. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why now? </strong>The regulatory order was <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/31/business/google-antitrust-justice-department.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upended</a> by the evolution of Big Tech’s free, consumer-revered services. That’s forced regulators to split up oversight of antitrust cases and merger reviews.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead: </strong>Breaking up Big Tech is already a talking point for some 2020 campaigners, whose debate prep will surely include practicing the lines, “Facebook should be broken up because...” And as for the companies themselves? Shares of Google parent Alphabet <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-06-03/alphabet-falls-to-lowest-in-five-months-as-doj-mulls-probe?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell</a> 6.12% and Facebook -7.51% yesterday.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/06/04/warren-buffett-awkward-lunch-2019?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Warren Buffett and the Most Awkward Lunch of 2019
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1559599016.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em><a href="https://twitter.com/justinsuntron/status/1135577230489268224?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1135577230489268224&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bloomberg.com%2Fnews%2Farticles%2F2019-06-03%2Fcrypto-pioneer-pays-4-57-million-for-lunch-with-warren-buffett&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@Justinsuntron</a></em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Vocal cryptocurrency entrepreneur Justin Sun <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-06-03/crypto-pioneer-pays-4-57-million-for-lunch-with-warren-buffett?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bid a record</a> $4.6 million for a charity lunch with vocal cryptocurrency <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/crypto-promoter-wins-bidding-war-for-lunch-with-warren-buffett-11559587135?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">skeptic</a> Warren Buffett. What do you think they’ll talk about?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">About Sun: </strong>In 2017, he launched Tronix—yesterday the world’s 11th largest crypto. But after reading the <a href="https://medium.com/@Tronfoundation/an-open-letter-to-the-community-warren-buffett-charity-lunch-8c5bf25d4fe8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">open letter</a> Sun posted ahead of the Buffett lunch, we’re shocked his background isn’t in law.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Even one of the most successful investors of all times can sometimes miss a coming wave,” Sun said, pointing out Buffett’s copped to missing the boat on Amazon, Alphabet, and Apple.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>You know when someone says “what’s up” and you respond with “good”? This could be 100x more awkward. Buffett’s had some...<em>colorful </em>characterizations of bitcoin. We’re partial to “probably rat poison squared,” but “a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/06/03/crypto-entrepreneur-to-pay-4point6-million-for-charity-lunch-with-bitcoin-skeptic-warren-buffett.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delusion</a>, basically” comes in a close second.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Will Sun’s pitch be enough to change the mind of someone who thinks bitcoin “attracts charlatans”? Who knows, but at the very least he's sitting down with one. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/06/04/blackstone-turns-warehouse-home?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Blackstone Turns a Warehouse Into a Home
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday we mentioned that PE firm Blackstone <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-06-03/blackstone-buys-18-7-billion-u-s-property-assets-from-glp?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bought</a> the U.S. warehouse portfolio of Singapore’s GLP in the largest private real estate transaction in history.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So why did Blackstone pay $18.7 billion for a bunch of empty boxes? It’s a question that could really derail your day, until you return home to 10 packages outside your door and think, “okay that makes sense.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A bet on warehousing is a bet on online shopping.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Both </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/06/03/amazon-says-over-10-million-items-are-now-available-for-one-day-shipping/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Amazon</a></span><span> and </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/05/13/walmart-announces-next-day-delivery-firing-back-at-amazon.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Walmart</a></span><span> recently announced plans to offer one-day shipping, and establishing warehouses close to population centers is critical to that effort.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>E-commerce sales are </span><span><a href="https://www.census.gov/retail/mrts/www/data/pdf/ec_current.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still climbing</a></span><span>, up 3.6% in the first quarter from a quarter earlier.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>When the global co-head of Blackstone real estate said logistics is the firm’s “highest conviction global investment theme today,” he’s not kidding. The company just added roughly 1,300 properties and 179 million square feet to <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/1738601e-8599-11e9-a028-86cea8523dc2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly 2x</a> its existing U.S. industrial footprint.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/06/04/jay-z-1b-businessman-business-man?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Jay-Z Is a $1B Businessman Business, Man
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://genius.com/Jay-z-run-this-town-lyrics?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">https://genius.com/Jay-z-run-this-town-lyrics</a>Yesterday, <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/zackomalleygreenburg/2019/06/03/jay-z-billionaire-worth/?utm_source=morning_brew#7128864b3a5f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Forbes reported</a> that Jay-Z has reached the three comma club. The magazine said that makes him the first hip-hop billionaire, beating Dr. Dre to the honorific.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Show me what he’s got: </strong>Shawn Carter has 22 Grammys and 14 No. 1 albums to his name...but valued at $75 million, his music catalog is only a minor part of his total net worth. Forbes’s money-counting elves say that’s the third <em>least</em> valuable of his assets.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The rapper’s stake in $300/bottle champagne company Armand de Brignac, which he’s touted in </span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FS4U-HAHwps&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">many</a></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://genius.com/Jay-z-run-this-town-lyrics?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a</a></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://genius.com/Meek-mill-whats-free-lyrics?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">song</a></span><span>, tops the list at $310 million.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Forbes put Jay’s cash and investments at $220 million. That includes a $70 million slice of Uber, which he bought for $2 million in 2013.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Rumi and Sir Carter are actually Jay’s second pair of twins. Both cognac company D’Ussé and streaming service Tidal are each worth $100 million.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bonus: </strong>Looking for a great read on Mr. Knowles? <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2012/09/09/t-magazine/the-house-that-hova-built.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">This</a> from the NYT is the Brew writers’ favorite.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1559599551.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We wanted to do something truly memorable for readers who share the Brew. So we called up our friends at Nasdaq and said, “Let’s put together something truly memorable for readers who share the Brew.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And they said, “Sounds good, how about this?”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Five lucky winners will...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Come to NYC to attend the Opening Bell at Nasdaq</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Take an exclusive tour of the Nasdaq Market Site Studios</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>See your face on the Nasdaq Tower in Times Square</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Have lunch with our co-founders, Alex Lieberman and Austin Rief</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Attend a happy hour with the Brew Crew</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So how can you win? </strong>This week, share the Brew with your friends, family, and coworkers using your unique referral link. 1 referral = 1 ticket entered into the giveaway.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/?kid={{profile.vars.referral_code}}&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Enter to win</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>*Must be living in the U.S. or Canada to be eligible to win.</em></sup></p>

href=\"https://www.axios.com/live-apple-debuts-new-mac-pro-previews-ios-macos-updates-df00af15-d493-4085-868a-71940cf54386.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekicked off\u003c/a\u003e yesterday, and...gulp some coffee now, we’ve got a lot of changes to catch you up on. As it deals with \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tech-antitrust-exclusive/exclusive-u-s-justice-dept-considering-apple-probe-sources-idUSKCN1T42DD?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea nosy Justice Department\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/05/15/apple-suppliers-foxconn-japan-display-report-disappointing-results.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eflagging iPhone sales\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-i-phone-sales-in-china-could-be-cut-by-50-thanks-to-trumps-trade-war-115735359.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea U.S. conflict with China\u003c/a\u003e that rhymes with “paid lore,” Apple (-1.01%) is making moves with virtually all its flagship products. The tech giant...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUnveiled a new Mac Pro. \u003c/strong\u003eThe new professional desktop computer \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/6/3/18646424/apple-mac-pro-redesign-new-specs-features-photos-wwdc-2019?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecomes with\u003c/a\u003e bells, whistles, and a whole lot of storage. It’s the newest model in two years and costs a cool $5,999, though Apple says comparable products go for over $8,000.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWants you to know it cares about privacy…*mumbles* unlike \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003esome\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e people. \u003c/strong\u003eIt \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-touts-new-privacy-features-amid-scrutiny-of-tech-giants-11559589479?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erevealed iOS 13\u003c/a\u003e, which includes Dark Mode for iPhone as well as some notable privacy features.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOne function limits apps’ abilities to pull user's location to a one-time permission (rather than an indefinite one).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnother allows users to sign into third-party apps with an Apple ID instead of Google and Facebook accounts, which are vulnerable to data harvesting.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eConfirmed rumors it’s replacing iTunes. \u003c/strong\u003eApple’s newest desktop operating system, called MacOS Catalina (no relation to the wine mixer), \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/talkingtech/2019/06/03/whats-new-from-apple-at-wwdc/1327644001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereplaces iTunes\u003c/a\u003e with desktop versions of the Apple Music, TV, and Podcast apps currently on iPads and iPhones.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnnounced an iPad-specific operating system. \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s called iPadOS, and it’s intended to make iPads feel more like desktop computers. As \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/03/technology/wwdc-apple.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe NYT puts it\u003c/a\u003e, Apple’s trying to turn the iPad into your work computer.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUpdated the Apple Watch. \u003c/strong\u003eThe new WatchOS includes an App Store for your wrist as well as a bunch more Apple apps like audiobooks and voice memos.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhew...nice job reading all that. Some more context: At last year’s WWDC, \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/bringing-ios-apps-to-the-mac-1528139732-8504ade4-45f7-468f-af9f-5ad976cb3c79.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAxios identified\u003c/a\u003e the company’s efforts to integrate iOS and MacOS going forward. Tech\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBig Tech regulation has turned into a fantasy league in which agencies \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ftc-to-examine-how-facebook-s-practices-affect-digital-competition-11559576731?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026mod=article_inline\u0026mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echoose\u003c/a\u003e which massive company they’ll be responsible for overseeing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWith the #2 overall pick...\u003c/strong\u003eThe FTC is reportedly prepping an antitrust investigation into Facebook, which comes days after reports suggesting the DOJ will do the same with Google. And even if this is a half-PPR league, don't count out Apple and Amazon.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eApple \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/06/03/apple-drops-on-report-that-doj-has-jurisdiction-over-potential-antitrust-probe.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanswers\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to the DOJ, which is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ealso\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e allegedly mulling an antitrust case as of this week.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAmazon (-4.64%) \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/06/02/amazon-could-face-heightened-antitrust-scrutiny-under-new-agreement-between-us-regulators/?utm_term=.4985fc8705fa\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elooks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to the FTC, though no concrete moves have been made yet. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy now? \u003c/strong\u003eThe regulatory order was \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/31/business/google-antitrust-justice-department.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eupended\u003c/a\u003e by the evolution of Big Tech’s free, consumer-revered services. That’s forced regulators to split up oversight of antitrust cases and merger reviews.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead: \u003c/strong\u003eBreaking up Big Tech is already a talking point for some 2020 campaigners, whose debate prep will surely include practicing the lines, “Facebook should be broken up because...” And as for the companies themselves? Shares of Google parent Alphabet \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-06-03/alphabet-falls-to-lowest-in-five-months-as-doj-mulls-probe?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell\u003c/a\u003e 6.12% and Facebook -7.51% yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eskeptic\u003c/a\u003e Warren Buffett. What do you think they’ll talk about?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAbout Sun: \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2017, he launched Tronix—yesterday the world’s 11th largest crypto. But after reading the \u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/@Tronfoundation/an-open-letter-to-the-community-warren-buffett-charity-lunch-8c5bf25d4fe8?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopen letter\u003c/a\u003e Sun posted ahead of the Buffett lunch, we’re shocked his background isn’t in law.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Even one of the most successful investors of all times can sometimes miss a coming wave,” Sun said, pointing out Buffett’s copped to missing the boat on Amazon, Alphabet, and Apple.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eYou know when someone says “what’s up” and you respond with “good”? This could be 100x more awkward. Buffett’s had some...\u003cem\u003ecolorful \u003c/em\u003echaracterizations of bitcoin. We’re partial to “probably rat poison squared,” but “a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/06/03/crypto-entrepreneur-to-pay-4point6-million-for-charity-lunch-with-bitcoin-skeptic-warren-buffett.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edelusion\u003c/a\u003e, basically” comes in a close second.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWill Sun’s pitch be enough to change the mind of someone who thinks bitcoin “attracts charlatans”?
